algorithm_technique: Dutch National Flag algorithm (three-way partitioning) using three pointers.
problem_summary_simple: Sort an array containing only 0s, 1s, and 2s in-place.
problem_summary_technical: Sort an array of 0s, 1s, and 2s in-place using a single pass and constant extra space.
key_insights: This is a classic partitioning problem, often solved with the Dutch National Flag algorithm.
Three pointers (low, mid, high) manage the boundaries of 0s, 1s, and 2s.
The algorithm processes elements in a single pass, ensuring in-place sorting.
